Reviews.Title: “good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: mkeith03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights. Check in was easy. The staff were friendly and the lobby was very nice. Our room was small, but had a comfortable king sized bed. The bathroom was a little outdated, but VERY clean. The rooftop deck was a very nice place to have breakfast. The breakfast was simple, but perfectly adequate. Free wifi was a plus. Also, the pool area was very relaxing. Hotel Melia has a lot of sitting areas throughout the hotel. This is both good and bad. One night, there was a very rowdy party going on in a sitting area close to our room. It took the front desk too long to send the partiers away. If I went back to Hotel Melia, I would definitely request a room that is far from the sitting areas.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: dgauss
Reviews.Content: A classic hotel with a great location right in the center of Ponce. Right by the plaza and cathedral and museums. Decent breakfast in a very pleasant rooftop setting. Helpful staff. Parking (fee) in adjacent lot. Internet. Before visiting, recheck the opening hours of the museums and Tibes; some may have changed.

Reviews.Title: “A Classic in Ponce”
Reviews.Author: BLACKJAV
Reviews.Content: Located in Central Ponce (entrance is in a busy street leading to main square) with a faÃ§ade facing Parque de Bombas. The lobby is a reflex of old grandeur wich is less evident in corridors and rooms a little run down. All said, rooms are old but clean and old AC works properly although a little noisily. Breakfast is a little scarce and served in a covered rooftop, enjoyable but even more run down. Parking is behind hotel and incredibly cheap ( 3$ per 24h, enter and leave as you wish) with an entrance direct to hotel until is late in the evening. There are plenty of restaurants and bars nearby and of course all atractions in the city. The only con is that you can hear the music of close bars, fortunately, your AC somehow blocks the noise...

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: philo04
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful - if you are someone who prefers the older hotels with charm and character over the new modern hotels, then this place is for you. We had the most amazing room with a view of the church, the main square and the fire station. Our room was basic with two queen sized beds and not too fancy but it was fine. You can tell it is an older hotel but they have kept it up pretty well. The a/c works well, they have cable and a fridge in the room. Our tub was a bit funky as it had been redone and was sort of unstable but we were traveling with a toddler so we were happy to have the tub. The outside of this hotel is beautiful and the hotel itself is amazing - the lobby is charming, the pool is great ( a bit cold on a windy day), the areas next to the elevator are so charming - they a have chairs and tables in wonderful spots to just relax and read. The rooftop breakfast area is fantastic with flowers and quite a view. Breakfast consists of juice, coffee and cereal and bread. They have parking right next door. We had a nice large terrace with a great view as well. The staff were very friendly and professional. We loved this hotel and loved the character it clearly has.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here...”
Reviews.Author: HollyStarSan
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay here... nothing fancy, but what I'd expect for the price. The location was PERFECT, especially for Carnival. Parking in back. Our breakfast had coffee, juice, cereals and a variety of danishes/bagels/breads. Bathrooms were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Make Ponce Part of Your Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: torobuque
Reviews.Content: Our room at the Hotel Melia not only faced the Plaza but had a large balcony and picture window. The room was large with plenty of closet and drawer space, table and chairs, a large counter in front of a mirror, and a decent size bathroom. Bed was comfortable; shower average. Parking was off street , reasonably priced, and easy access. The roof deck was a beautiful place to start the morning with their continental breakfast. We were there for four nights and used Ponce as our base for visiting nearby locations. The hotel is old and the design is a little strange....many rooms and their windows face interior and/or exterior corridors and do not offer much privacy with the curtains open. Pool looked inviting but did not use. Staff was gracious and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Centered around the Plaza”
Reviews.Author: SDB_SI
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for the price located in the center of town and convenient to all. The hotel was quaint and charming, the rooms were very comfortable and clean, staff very helpful and courteous, convenient parking and included a very nice continental breakfast. I only stayed 1 night so I couldn't enjoy the pool or relaxing atmosphere, but I would go back and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: kajofi
Reviews.Content: Last weekend I spent two nights at this hotel. It has an enviable location just steps from Plaza Las Delicias but in an quiet part of Cristina Street. My room was comparable to those on South Beach hotels I've been to. The only downside was that it did not have a personal safe box, which is provided at the front desk. My room was on the third floor which afforded partial views of the Cathedral, the historic firehouse, the La Perla theater, El VigÃ­a and SerrallÃ©s Castle. Dining and nightlife options are around the square, and nearby as well, most notably just steps away on Mayor @ Cristina. The hotel's parking fills up at night and closes so if you go out in your car and arrive late you'll most likely have to park on the street but it's relatively safe since Plaza Las Delicias and its environs usually have plenty of car and pedestrian traffic. Continental breakfast is provided but it should have more variety in my opinion but it's still better than having to pay for it. Overall I was very satisfied with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Ponce, PR”
Reviews.Author: Cgpabon01
Reviews.Content: Lovely & Charming old hotel next to towm central plaza.Excellent and friendly staff, very clean and coizy

Reviews.Title: “Really nice rstored old hotel in the center of Ponce, Puerto Ricp”
Reviews.Author: Jack F
Reviews.Content: This old hotel has been well-restored. It is located 1/2 block from the central square in old Ponce. The area has been well kept as well and offer excellent opportunites for night time dining and day time snacks. Several of the restaurants have outstanding cuisine. The staff of the hotel were more than accomodating. We arrived just before the high season, but during the festival of the Virgin of Guadalupe, without reservations, and were lucky enough to get the last remaining room. The room was small, but management forewarned us and insisted we see it first before taking it. It was small, but the air-conditioning worked, and we had no complaints. Other rooms are much more accomodating and all rooms are reasonable. The staff was extremely helpful with advice and making arrangements for us. In a conversation with one of the owners we learned that the restoration and improvements are an on-going project.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it.”
Reviews.Author: jl21Va
Reviews.Content: I thought this place was nice. On this particular trip, I was travelling alone and not looking for luxury. I just wanted a simple affordable place to stay while checking out Ponce. Melia was the perfect choice. Upon checking in, the front desk clerk offered me a couple free upgrade options as they were not very full that night. She was very honest about the pros and cons of each room. I chose the king bed room with a balcony overlooking the plaza, despite her caution that they would come clean the street early in the morning and could be a little noisy. I was happy with the choice as the view was great. The location is perfect for pedestrian sight seeing, right in the heart of Ponce. It was a warm day when I arrived and the pool felt great. A nice little oasis in the middle of the busy area. The hotel is old and has some expected wear and tear as a result. The elevator is small and does not inspire much confidence. Also the breakfast was pretty minimal. Don't expect much more than OJ and a bagel. The staff was helpful and able to give me clear driving directions upon departure. If you are looking for something basic in the heart of Ponce then Melia is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Great for those who appreciate fantastic location & classic old-school charm”
Reviews.Author: Katie D
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely experience at this hotel. It is located right on the central plaza in Ponce, a beautiful old town. The hotel has colonial architecture, and has been around for over 100 years. They have done a great job updating it, with a beautiful pool, gorgeous roof deck w/ fantastic views over the city, updated rooms w/ all the amenities (even if the structure is a bit older) and wonderfully helpful service desk folks. It is also well-priced, at about $90/night for two people (Puerto Rico is expensive!). You feel a bit like you're transported in time, think Midnight in Paris w/ all the amenities. However, if you're expecting super-modern Ramada/Raddisson style place, this is not the place for you. It is also next to some of the most delicious ice cream I've ever had - try the coconut. :)

Reviews.Title: “Best location in the city”
Reviews.Author: JDnt
Reviews.Content: Melia is the best location in Ponce for the value. Located in the center of this southern city in Puerto Rico, the Hotel Melia is comfortable, nice swimming pool! Don't expect a five star hotel but the value can not be matched. Accessible to the best places in Ponce. On every small trip I make to the south, I always stay in Melia!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Friendly Staff (great people!!!), and VERY clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: albert407
Reviews.Content: This place is very charming, clean and amazing location. You will be walking distance of many restaurants, Firefighter house, MANY small museaum, and many small bars. Also you are five dollars away by taxy to everything else. (Plaza del Caribe mall, La guancha port, small bars and movie cinema around thedowntown plaza, University and museaum. You have to take time toi visit the Ponce Art Museaum. Breakfast is free and Internet is fast and free. You will love the gelato store near by. Simply the best!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Ponce.”
Reviews.Author: Toby1948
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel only 3 nights. Perfect for visiting the area attractions. The staff was great from check-in to checkout. The Hotel has a great atmosphere and decor. The only problem we had was the location of our room facing Calle Cristina and on the 1st floor above the lobby. The street tends to have lots of traffic. At night there was a street drain or opening and every time a car went over it, it made a loud noise, which even with the AC, we were able to hear. We had room 111. The Continental breakfast needs to add a little more to its selection, like small PR pastries. Other than that we enjoyed staying there with our Yorkie dog.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good place to sleep at”
Reviews.Author: DavilaBayamon
Reviews.Content: Although accessible to many interesting places in Ponce city, too difficult to sleep there. I had to cancel my second night and find another hotel to stay at with my mother. Personnel a little indifferent. Pool too isolated.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Melia - Great location, clean hotel but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: TamandPete
Reviews.Content: There are four floors to his hotel but the top floor is used for (free) continental breakfast and banquets. Something to remember if you stay on a Friday or Saturday night. From the 3rd floor you hear everything. Our room was a king size room which had a desk in it. There was little room for anything else. But for short term, it is fine. The bed was average for sleeping in. There is nice pool for relaxing and paid parking ($3) with a security guard which is good if plan to park for the day and the street only allows metered parking. We were driving and it was easy to find our way to the hotel, but the hotel itself has two signs. So when we arrived at what he thought was the main enterance, it was closed. Turns out this is the side and the enterance is 1/2 a block right around the corner. The hotel is in a central location and there is park across the street, shops and restuarants and ice cream shops all within blocks. It is close enough to Castillo Serralles and Cruceta del Vigia, both of which we toured, that you can see them from the hotel. I wouldn't recommend walking as it is pretty much up hill all the way. There is also a poor example of a Japanese garden. It is a small area with some bonsai trees and a koi pond. I wouldn't pay to go see it if I knew before hand. Breakfast was inlcuded and included cereal, bread, corn bread, donuts, and beef empanadas with coffee, tea and juice. Sitting out on the open deck was nice but the pigeons were insane so we had to move inside. We ate dinner at Cafe Tomas which was right around the corner and served fantics dinners. The hotel also offered Wifi which worked great.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great hotel”
Reviews.Author: IxChel3300
Reviews.Content: Like many on here have commented - the Melia is a grand dame who needs some refurbishing. However, having read this, I knew what to expect. The pleasant staff, excellent location, and price make up for the dated appearance. One word of advice to the hotel - do something about the continental breakfast! It is awful! I can't understand why, in an area that has year-round access to fresh fruit & coffee plantations, there isn't any fresh fruit in the continental breakfast and the coffee is so awful!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but its seen better days”
Reviews.Author: DC2BK
Reviews.Content: I wish that I could have seen this hotel in its heyday- the lobby is the best-looking part of it today. Still, the bed was comfy (perhaps a little too soft) & the rooftop dining area was nice on a sunny day (even if the view faces away from the square & is somewhat obscured by buildings). We didn't linger & would recommend this for no more than one night. If you're just passing through Ponce like us then why not save a couple of bucks? Downers included mosquitos in our room & the fact that the staff didn't tell us about the parking lot out back until we checked out the next morning. Still, there was only 1 other group besides us at breakfast- more toast or juice anyone?

Reviews.Title: “I liked this hotel, reminded me of Europe”
Reviews.Author: TheMadSigntist
Reviews.Content: What can I say, I like older hotels. They have some charm and history. Nice lobby. This hotel certainly wasn't perfect but it was nice I thought. The staff were very friendly and the room was nice enough. I think it was good value for the money and the location was great. Just don't eat at Cafe Tomas, the Pizzalato place across the square was pretty good though.

Reviews.Title: “Charming lobby, great location, rooms need help”
Reviews.Author: michaelmo
Reviews.Content: Was in Ponce on trip back to island with my Mom, having lived there when I was very young. We shared a room at the Melia. It's a great location, right off plaza and next to the Parque de Bombas, heart of the city, within walking distance of everything. The hotel is very much like a 2 or 3 star hotel in Spain, charming lobby, very nice staff. The room we got was right out of the 80's, really needed to be remodeled, but the beds were fine, seemed clean. The free breakfast is pretty paltry - cornflakes and pastries with coffee and juice but it is set on a terrace with a lovely view.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice, great location”
Reviews.Author: Pakita72
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in this hotel for an activity I was attending nearby. Staff is really nice and willing to help. Room was impressively clean. You could tell it had been cleaned up recently, and that they were expecting us. Did not use their parking, since I found a spot on the street nearby, but the cost is $3 for 24 hours, which I guess is not bad. Continental breakfast was varied and tasty. Would recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely historic hotel with an exceptionally great staff”
Reviews.Author: Vfoote2
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel based on reviews. It turned out to be a great choice. Great location. Had a rental car so we were able to cover half of Puerto Rico with Melia as our home base. Overall maintenance of the room and bathroom was excellent. No problem with A/C. Continental breakfast was fresh. Hotel parking rates was surprisenly cheap compared to others in the area. We lost our safe key and the staff turned went out of their way to help us look for it. Unfortunately we didn't find it so we paid the locksmith fee. We weren't upset about it or anything but the staff felt really bad for us. You would have thought they lost our key. Everyone at the Melia made us feel at home. If we return to Ponce, we'll certainly stay at the Melia.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: kcgreyhound
Reviews.Content: Melia is a nice, old hotel right in the heart of Ponce. The only problem with my stay is that I went during Holy week, so EVERYTHING was closed, even Burger King. This was a ghost town after 5 p.m. The hotel itself was comfortable, clean and served its purpose well for our group. The only complaint is the same I have with all older hotels--no electrical outlets to recharge phones, cameras, iPods. The elevator was broken upon check-in, which meant we had to carry bags up three flights, but they had a guy on it right away. The breakfast served on the fourth floor was good, and the rooftop patio was nice also. Took a dip in the small pool, not bad at all. If my journeys bring me back to Ponce, I'd gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at the hotel 1 night. While it...”
Reviews.Author: Jadavidson82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel 1 night. While it was very nice that the staff let us check in early, the room was tiny and not well kept. The location is great. We had lunch at the ramada in the same area and would suggest looking into this hotel instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: portlandorer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on the main square. If you had a balcony room as we did, expect some noise into the night, but you can get rooms that will be extremely quiet--just not with the view of the square and the hills. The room was quite spacious and well-kept. The staff was extremely helpful and spoke fluent English, not something that you always find outside San Juan. The breakfast isn't much, but there's a great deck/verandah for view and/or happy hour. Two free computers are available for guest use. Parking is in an adjacent secured lot for $3 per day.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant well kept hotel on the plaza in ponce”
Reviews.Author: megwr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Melia recently for 4 days during a trip to PR. it is a lovely hotel. The double room was pretty small--we had a very good rate on it --but the king room was spacious. The hotel is clean, cool, pleasant., The staff were friendly and helpful and seemed to be completely bilingual. The towels are thick, the bathrooms immaculate, and it has a small very refreshing pool in the back. Also guarded parking for $3 which is great. They offered a selfserve breakfast with cereal, pastries, toast and juice on a roof top terrace with a nice view of the mountains. it is a very nice old hotel, I recommend it if you want to stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful, clean & charming, with a discount!”
Reviews.Author: Ixlilixa
Reviews.Content: After slogging around the square (con mis padres) in the historic part of Ponce looking at rooms in other hotels we returned to the first hotel, Melia Hotel (the guidebook had recommended it) which also had the best price. Stayed 2 nights, all the desk staff were friendly, going so far as to give us directions over the phone when we lacked a map to find the hotel, helping my mother use the TV remote control in our room, and there is FREE COMPUTER/INTERNET USE for guests (especially helpful since we were not carrying a laptop). The pool has the feel of a hidden luxury, small but sunny. Great location around the corner from King's (ice cream place), and cheap parking next door for hotel guest, I think $3/night.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Dame of Ponce”
Reviews.Author: rrzzll
Reviews.Content: This is the original hotel in Ponce, built in the late 19th century and recently rennovated. Mixes old-style grandeur with many of the comforts of modern times. The architecture is part of the enchantment. You immediately have a feeling of nostalgia upon entering the lobby. Front desk service was excellent. Rates are reasonable. Hotel was spotless throughout, quite an accomplishment for a structure of this age. Hotel was very quiet, even though centrally located right off the plaza. Our room had a walk-in closet and spacious bathroom. Mattresses and pillows were a bit hard but not too uncomfortable. Continental breakfast is included, the highlight of which was the setting in an outdoor terrace. Swimming pool area was outstanding. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this dump”
Reviews.Author: wings121
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this dump for a night. We could not belive how dirty this place is. You would think that the owner of this place would take pride of a "landmark", but not. When we got to our room, We where allmost cried. It was really dirty,smelly,HOROBLE. What is wrong with the poeple that work there, Do they have a vision problem? Can't they see the grime? I suggest for eveyone to skip this place.

Reviews.Title: “Melia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sparkleboy
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Melia Hotel. The room was spacious and we had great food around the hotel - eg Times Square, Bukit Bintang, Amoy Street, Pavillion.

Reviews.Title: “Stop your gripin'!!! Best hotel in Ponce for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Traviata5013
Reviews.Content: I swear I've never heard so many whinies. The Melia hotel (not of the Spanish Melia chain of hotels), is a family-run hotel, dated back to the 19th century. It's in the center of the city, across from the historic firehouse. Indeed, it's an old hotel, but it's kept up and is very well-run. We stayed there in May 2009, and didn't have our credit card # stolen, nor anything of the kind. The staff is friendly and helpful. My only recommendation is not to stay in one of the rooms facing the plaza, because it can get noisy, especially if there is loud music at night. I suggest you pick one of the rooms toward the back of the hotel on the 3rd floor, overlooking the inner courtyard. Breakfast is lovely because you eat on the roof garden, and the little finches fly in and join you, hoping to get some of your orange juice. For the price, you can't beat it. The Hilton is for whimps!

Reviews.Title: “Cute place, lots of character (and not in the bad way!)”
Reviews.Author: eamg79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night during a 5-day trip along the coast. Nice, but small rooms did the trick for us. Out our door we had a cool view of the surrounding mountains and the cute courtyard below. Enjoyed the history of the hotel and family that had run it. Staff was friendly and helpful when we arrived late and needed dinner options. There's a great deck on the top floor where they serve breakfast. Breakfast was decent with surprisingly good coffee, but some fresh fruit would have been a welcome addition. Don't know if we'll be back in Ponce, but if we were to end up there again, I'd put Melia on the itinerary.

Reviews.Title: “save your money”
Reviews.Author: Ginrickey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a trip in which we spent two nights in Ponce at Hotel Melia. We stayed in room 314 that had a balcony facing the town square. That was the only good thing I can say about the place. No, I take that back, there was plenty of hot water. The rugs were so filthy you had to wash your feet before getting into bed. The air conditioning blows right down on the bed and you either had it on and were freezing or had to turn it off and sweat because it did not have a circulating fan.

Reviews.Title: “3 days in Ponce”
Reviews.Author: MWL
Reviews.Content: Hotel Melia has "character" - we stayed in room 314 which has a balcony overlooking the square . Evening wine and cheese on the balcony was memorable. We had a car so drove to the local supermarket to buy wine and cheese etc. -very reasonable.There is a great bar opposite Hotel Belgica just across the square - great spot - superb sandwiches -cheap beer - tiny place but great local spot. The ice cream shop below the Melia is excellent constant stream of people all day.We drove down to the harbor Saturday and Sunday -lively spot ,plenty of food ,music lots of local families and some artisans.Make sure you go around by the observation tower where there is a dock and hundreds of Tarpon congregate as they are fed by people-quite a sight. We even saw people trying to hand feed the moray eels in the rocks !! We drove up and down the coast and into the mountains - found great roadside food and interesting towns. We found the Hotel Melia staff helpful when approached but lacked a welcoming attitude.A "Hello" how was your day- Good morning enjoy your day etc. would add a little polish to the atmosphere. The pool was great. Excellent TV- Even had Fox soccer so I could watch the games from England - all movie channels and no charge for internet.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: hcfort
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Melia for one night. I was ready to leave Ponce after an hour. City was dirty, lots of trash on the streets (and everywhere else people could dump it), lots of boarded up or abandoned stores and homes, lots of aggressive homeless. The rooms are dirty, tiny, and smelly. The only redeeming part of our stay was an evening spent at Mark's (the hotel restaurant) chatting with Mark and his wife Melody. An important note: The hotel put $780 worth of holds on our credit card for one night's stay...This put a serious damper on the rest of our stay, as we had no access to that money. Ridiculous. Overall, have a great dinner at Mark's, but skip the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place!”
Reviews.Author: dlareg85
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just nice and is very well located and very close to everything. The only thing that I didn't like about this place was the bathroom. They don't have AC and the are really hot. The rest is nice! I recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel with average amenities”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie1717
Reviews.Content: Based on prior reviews, I was a little skeptical of this hotel, but my husband had stayed here several years ago and had a positive experience. I have to say that overall, I was okay with the choice, but if left to my own devices I probably would not have picked the Melia. This is an OLD building with a good location right in the center of Ponce and across the street from a nice park. It is nowhere near the water and the entrance to the hotel is more than a little confusing, as is the parking. The amenities were minimal, continental breakfast very basic. If you are used to the US 5* rating system, you will probably give this hotel a 2*, but for the area it is better than most. Not super clean, but no bugs or anything that you would notice if you aren't super picky like I am. The bathroom was tiny with old fixtures and limited hot water. I would not recommend for a young crowd however as this hotel appeals to a quiet, seemingly older crowd . The elevator is extremely small also. The pool area looked nice, but we didn't use it as it was pouring rain the entire time. There was a basic continental breakfast on the rooftop that would have been very nice if it had not been raining. Staff at the front desk were helpful but they recommended a few restaurants within walking distance that were closed (We didn't know that lots of places are closed on Mondays). After we walked to both of them and realized they were closed we also realized that we probably shouldn't be walking the streets at night. Lots of local loitering going on and there is an increase in crime in Ponce over the past several years. Overall I would say this would compare to a 2* hotel in the states.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck!!! And no historic feel/charm will convince me otherwise.”
Reviews.Author: tushkan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Melia Ponce for one night on Christmas 07 and had a room overlooking Plaza del Delicias. Overall our experience was negative, but mostly because we were caught off guard as we did not realize such properties exist in the US Commonwealth (any one-star american motel will beat this property when it comes to cleanliness). Cons: unreasonably high rates considering the property's caliber - we paid $140 i believe for the Superior room, the hotel is smelly and unkempt (pubic hairs on the white bed blanket, and the room overall was phenomenally dirty - and i was hoping if we order the most expensive room we'll avoid the perills other travellers were describing on this site) Pros: located on the main plaza, not that great distances are an issue in this city, it's fairly small and all the attractions are within 5-15 min walk. Overall, in the hindsight, having travelled in Europe, i would bypass Ponce all together due to it being way too rundown for my tastes or possibly avoid staying there overnight - the city's colonial architecture, art museum and Parca de Bombas are nice to see, but i did not feel they warrant spending the night in what seems to be a city with no decent hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nneico
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night in a room on the second floor. Room was decent sized, with a King sized bed. The hotel is beautiful, and the pool looked nice, though we didn't end up using it. The complimentary continental breakfast was lacking. It runs from 7:30-10:00 and we arrived around 9 to find no milk and very little orange juice left. The only whole fruit they had out was hot from being placed in the sun. They provided donuts and some sort of pastries with jelly, neither of which were very tasty. We left rather hungry (and thirsty).

Reviews.Title: “Nice historic place”
Reviews.Author: Wombatter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in May 2008. The hotel is very conveniently located to the main plaza (just 1/2 block away), and you can see the Parque de Bombas from the roof. It's a bit tough to find while driving with the one-way streets (and our GPS had a couple of them as 2-way which made for some fun), but once you have that figured out it's easy. Parking is right next door at $3 a day. The hotel rooms are nice; you can tell it's an older hotel (as things are rather small), given that though it was fine. The balcony views are excellent, and our air conditioner worked well. The staff were very friendly and welcoming, and the lobby is very nice looking. The pool is also very nice, especially after a long day, though it's a bit small. The only downside I'd mention is the breakfast. It's really no more than what you'd get at a run-of-the-mill cheap chain hotel in the US; I expected at least fresh fruit or something. Other than that, we were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “YUCK - hotel and Ponce”
Reviews.Author: TENN_Beach_Bum
Reviews.Content: Once we found the hotel, the staff was friendly and helpful. The lobby was nice and gave a historic feel to the hotel. The good ends there... The room was small and cramped. The bathroom needed a serious overhaul or at least a really good scrubbing. The â€œair conditioningâ€� was controlled with just the speed of the fan â€“ not the actual temperature. So, we messed with it all night long as we were hot then cold then hot. The bed did not have a fitted sheet and the flat sheet wasnâ€™t positioned correctly so we struggled with trying not to sleep on the bare mattress. We thought the city of Ponce was going to be a neat place to stroll while viewing historic buildings. We felt scared at night and the daytime wasnâ€™t much better in some parts of the city. Our next visit to Puerto Rico will be without Ponce. It was hot and dirty and unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, fairly comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: brookej79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 1 night and found it to be fairly comfortable. The bed was a little hard and the room a little small but we weren't in Ponce to hang out in the hotel room. The breakfast wasn't great but the rooftop where they serve it was very enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, decent room”
Reviews.Author: luvPR
Reviews.Content: This is a very old hotel, and while it was not plush, it was fine. Comfortable clean bed; bare bones bathroom BUT great water pressure and plenty of hot water! The view from our small balcony of the Plaza was incredible. Friendly, helpful front desk staff. Marks - the restaurant that isn't actually part of the hotel, but you enter it through the Melia's lobby - is A+. We had two great dinners - great service, food and wine.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need a thorough cleaning”
Reviews.Author: Cruzantime
Reviews.Content: The hotel restaurant, Mark's, is expensive but fantastic. The hotel staff is very helpful and the location is ideal. We stayed in two different rooms over a long weekend, and my only complaint had to do with the cleanliness of the rooms - the carpets and bathroom floors were dirty, and I suspect that the air conditioner filters had not been cleaned in some time because our noses always ran when we were in the rooms. Whenever our two year old dropped a toy that rolled under the beds, it was pretty scary trying to retrieve it. We also didn't want to be anywhere near the toilets in bare feet. New carpeting and better vacuuming and bathroom mopping by housekeeping would have made for a completely different experience.

Reviews.Title: “Free...Internet Wifi.....Exelent Location......”
Reviews.Author: VEROTAMPA
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Melia for 2 nights and is great, the people at the front desk as very helpfull with us,they give us directions for see a few atracctions in Ponce.The hotel has wonderfull lobby and the rooms are small but very clean and charming.They have a roof terrace in the 4floor with a continental breakfast cereal,juice, coffee,pastries and baggles The best..FREE WIFI...you can bring your laptop for work...

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: BroncoBill
Reviews.Content: An old spanish hotel with a lot of charm. The rooms were small, but very comfortable, with hairdryers, ironing boards, shampoos, etc. The rooftop continental breakfast was quite nice, and overlooks the hillside of Ponce. The staff at this hotel was very impressive, especially the front desk. They were VERY helpful and up to date on the local information. The restaurant there is a bit pricey and I did not eat there. Downtown Ponce virtually shuts down at 8 pm during the week, and wound up eating at Churches Chicken. I was there for two nights, but one would have been more than enough.

Reviews.Title: “Old”
Reviews.Author: RheVancouver_Canada
Reviews.Content: Just like everyone else is saying-it's an old hotel. Tiny rooms, old windows, old decor, but clean. Really nice lobby, but I wasn't comfortable using the elevator-can barely fit two people. The new pool is a nice add on, but they should start updating their rooms. We only stayed there for one night-don't think we could do much longer is such a small room! Plus, the nightlife is next to none, police are everywhere and alot of boarded up buildings, makes me wonder how safe it is?

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, great location”
Reviews.Author: OlyaDallas
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, has quite a bit of character, is in the best location in town - totally met the expectations. Good quality rooms, showers, etc. Nice restaurant on premises. Very good value for money. Reception desk is very responsive and goes above and beyond in finding information you need. Minor downside is that the parking is in the back, and you have to drag your luggage pretty far back to the entrance - and since you have to turn in the key to the parking attendant, leaving much stuff in the vehicle is not an option. They do not have the porters, so we were a little stuck with our many bags - but the manager was nice enough to help us get our bags in. Overall, good experience. We stayed for just one night, and would stay again if we are back to ponce.

Reviews.Title: “thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: karyn_carlo
Reviews.Content: Ponce rocks and Melia is incredible. If you like small, old fashioned places with Spanish revival style architecture stay here. sure there is a little peeling paint, but that's all part of the charm. the rooms are spacious with very high ceilings, most with small balconies. the prices are more than reasonable. you get free, unlimited internet usage, a pool, free continental breakfast, and you are right there on the plaza next to the Parque de Bombas and the Cathedral. it was a highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “A very European feel....”
Reviews.Author: love2traveltogether
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 1 night at the very quaint Melia Hotel in Ponce. The location was great since it is right on the square. Upon walking into the lobby the ambiance is such that you feel like you are somewhere in Europe. The staff were very friendly and for a historic hotel you can tell the grounds and the building are very well maintained. Parking at the hotel is very convenient as there is a large parking lot next to the hotel and the cost is only $3.00 a day. Our room was small but very clean and very cozy. A continental breakfast is included with your stay. It is located on the 4th floor and is very simple but nice. If you want a good place to go to for breakfast, have the hotel direct you to the Gladiola Cafe. It is wonderful. We did not find out about it until later in the afternoon, but had we known we definitely would have went there for breakfast. We did have some wonderful flan and ice cream there and the ambiance is great. Walking around the square is so nice, many little shops and the Parque De Bombas is a must see. If traveling to the Ponce area the Hotel Melia definitely gets our vote....

Reviews.Title: “Melia - a bit dusty, but charming and friendly”
Reviews.Author: WendyJG
Reviews.Content: After driving through the outskirts of Ponce, I was really glad to arrive at Melia - as others have noted, the location can't be beat and you can leave the car in the hotel's parking lot while you explore the city. (Not that the outskirts are "bad" - just filled with American chain stores and restaurants, which I can see anywhere in the U.S., thank you.) If you arrive on a Monday night, as we did, give things a chance - the city was quite deserted and it was tough to find a restaurant that was open. I thought "What the heck was I doing, booking a hotel for two nights here?" The next morning, though, the city square was filled with school groups, vendors, and people hanging out in the park, and much more vibrant. Be sure to walk around and see the different styles of architecture! And be sure to buy your Alto Grande coffee here as opposed to San Juan ($9.59 vs. $14). Melia itself is quite charming - the Moorish-style tiles and stucco made me think of the Mediterranean coast - but a bit dated. Don't expect the amenities of a larger hotel chain, like an in-room mini fridge, a writing desk, or room service. There IS a business center for guests, though, with internet/fax capabilities. Breakfast was almost exactly the same fare as a Comfort Inn or Holiday Inn Express - cold cereal, toast, pastries, coffee, juice. (Don't expect hot water for tea or skimmed milk....when in Rome....) On our second day, there was no breakfast at all; I don't know what was up with that! But there are cafes around the square where you can get breakfast. Melia's breakfast is no longer served on the roof, but poolside. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant (Mark's) so I can't speak to that. I'd like to go back to Ponce in a few years and see what more has been done to rehab the city and its buildings. At first I thought the city looked a bit bedraggled, but then I came to prefer it over the overrated San Juan. The mountain setting is beautiful, and the people are friendly. We would definitely stay at the Melia, too.

Reviews.Title: “a little oasis”
Reviews.Author: JimboinATL
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in Ponce, PR! The staff was grateous and courteous and knew all the regular touristy things ("Where is a good restaurant") as well as being able to help set up my computer for the WIFI network (A Free of Charge Extra that is quite nice). The continental breakfast is nothing to brag about, but the pool in the couryard is GREAT especially after a long day of touring. The room was smaller, but not cramped. It was an older style, but not bad. We were inside the courtyard, which cut down on street noises (good for light sleepers) and up on the 2nd floor. If I was to do it again, I'd try to get the fourth floor (minimize traffic noises & be closer to the breakfast). But in all reality, this is a nice hotel although a little older in it's fashion.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we picked Melia over the others”
Reviews.Author: missvanity1999
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Melia while on a driving tour of Puerto Rico. It was definately a treat to come around the corner and see we picked a great option. My boyfriend and I stayed in one of the original rooms in the Hotel which was wonderful - definately the best hotel we had stayed in yet on the trip. Bathroom was small but efficient. Our friends were in the newest portion of the hotel and that fit their lifestyle perfcetly (I thought the room looked a little like the inside of a Holiday Inn). The pool was wonderful - great little cubby tables tucked in throughout the hotel to talk or play cards. We had an AMAZING dinner at Mark's at Melia. I think everyone fell in love with the chef at the first bite!

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: trulla79
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, the oldest in town, big rooms with big beds, private bathrooms, clean, elevator available, breakfast included and served on the roof with a nice view. breakfast has not a big choice, staff is friendly but everytime very busy, donÂ´t ask to much. internet terminals available for free

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MattGr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Melia for a couple of days and loved it. It is perfectly located near the central square. Within walking distance of anything you'd want to see in Ponce. It's a lovely property, clean, well-maintained, and well-run. The staff is accommodating and helpful. I'd definitely stay there again if traveling to Ponce. The hotel restaurant - Mark's - is also excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Decent considering it's in a small town”
Reviews.Author: yippee1999
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were great. Hotel clearly spent most of their money on an impressive lobby. The rest of the hotel is pretty "dated", especially the rooms themselves. I liked the outdoor corridors that lead to the rooms. They have a nice feel. But the rooms themselves felt a bit "old"... sorta "dirty", even if technically clean, if ya know what I mean. The included breakfast is really nothing to speak of. A few dried cereals to choose from with milk, coffee, something tasting like imitation orange juice, and some assorted pastry... nothing of any quality. They also offer some doughy sliced bread (think Wonder Bread) for toasting in the toaster. Overall, the breakfast was rather depressing as they really didn't seem to care to put any effort into it. The hotel restaurant, Mark's, was pretty nice, again, considering this is a pretty small town. The food quality was very good. We didn't really look into other hotel options for Ponce, but I guess I'd say this place is "ok".

Reviews.Title: “Melia preferred in Ponce”
Reviews.Author: farkels
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two days at the Hotel Melia and enjoyed it very much. The staff couldn't have been more helpful or friendly. The location was perfect; less than a block from the Plaza, so everything was walkable. The complementary breakfast on the rooftop provides a good view and was an enjoyable way to start the day. Parking ($3/day) is next door. The room was adequate and suitable for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: judisinger
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Melia (Feb. 6) but unfortunately didn't book ahead so were unable to get one of the deluxe rooms. However, our room was comfortable and the staff very friendly--the manager was wonderful. Parking was a few steps down the street at $3.00 per night, and the main plaza a few steps in the other direction. The hotel's design is rather rambling and quirky, but pleasant. I would recommend skipping the included buffet breakfast on the upstairs terrace--cardboard cups, paper plates and very sugary pastries. We had dinner at the Argentine steak house a few blocks away. Lovely outdoor terrace with tango music, but bad food and service--would have been better off at the Melia's restaurant where we had coffee and dessert. We loved Ponce--but didn't allow enough time to see everything.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was okay”
Reviews.Author: SimonC,Toronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just okay. Although our room was clean and a good size, it had a faint odour of cigarette smoke, which as a non-smoker, I found unpleasant. The hotel definitely had character of a byegone era and was pleasant enough, although the rooms seemed a little past their prime. The location of the hotel is excellent and is close to the main square. Also if you're driving, the $3 per day secured parking (with in and out privileges) next to the hotel is useful. The breakfast was minimal and I found it disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Coldupstate
Reviews.Content: This was my and my wife's first trip to Puerto Rico. I loved this hotel right in the middle of downtown Ponce. You have to remember, that this is not a big name brand hotel. We stayed at a few of those as well. However, this was my favorite. The hotel sits directly across from the town square. You are right in the middle of the heart of the small friendly city. The hotel and the location are well matched. It is on a City block (this is a small friendly city - along the lines of Ithaca, New York.) A hot dog man resides outside the entrance. The Lobby is beautiful. It houses an upscale restaurant. Nice easy going sitting area - very quaint. Hotel wireless works great. No charge. Breakfast on the roof of the hotel (enclosed) is OK - complimentary. Coffee was fine. Staff was great. Genuinely friendly and concerned. I cannot say enough. Helpful and eager to accomodate. Rooms are old style - again- this is not a big name brand hotel. Air Con is either on or off. Big switch over bedboard. I would turn it off and on to regulate temperature. But when it is on, it is cold. My room - (Deluxe) has a terrace that overlooks the square. This was a fantastic experience. Far more interesting than San Juan. Ponce is a great place to visit. Humming pedestrian mall in the street first thing in the morning (at night - a bit quiet) - museums nearby - $2 Trolly rides, and lots of bakeries. I will most certainly stay at the Melia again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, looking forward to renovation”
Reviews.Author: LAinLC
Reviews.Content: This lovely building is undergoing a renovation, and I wish I had known about the already renovated rooms. Mine was very small and quite worn. Things worked, but it really needed a thorough cleaning and much updating. The pool looked lovely, although I didn't get a chance to use it. The breakfast was pretty basic. The assets: the location and the staff. The desk staff couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating. The location - right off the main plaza -- made walking the charming streets of the old town a pleasure. Mark's at the Melia is one of the best restaurants in Puerto Rico but was closed the 2 nights we were in Ponce. We did have lunch there the last day, which was wonderful. King's Cream has great ice cream; 3 other great restaurants: Rincon Argentina; Cafe Tomas; and Restaurant de Las Tias (that's not the exact name, but close). The Art Museum is outstanding (note: contrary to our guidebook listing, it was open on a Monday, but the cafe wasn't). Israel, our guide on the Ponce trolley/tram, is very funny; he's worth finding. The History Museum guide was as knowledgeable as any history professor I've encountered. Don't miss the carnival masks!!

Reviews.Title: “Skip Ponce all together”
Reviews.Author: Bovi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Melia at the end of November 2006. We had a room on the 3rd floor. The room was approx $105 + tax. It had air conditioning BUT it didn't seem to make a difference which setting you put it on because they were all the same. In the morning I was all stuffed up. Our room clearly needed renovations. The BIG closet smelled like moth balls and everything was worn. The only place to eat nearby was the hotel restaurant which was very good but pricey. Nice location in the square and there's a parking lot around the corner for $3 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary_Lana
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Melia this November and had a wonderful experience. Mr. Albors, the manager, is very eager to please and pleasant. The rest of the staff is also extremely accomodating. The Melia is located right in the center of downtown Ponce and is near everything there. I was there as a tour escort for a group of college students and they loved that they could find shopping and bars right by the hotel. They also loved the little pool that the hotel has. The rooms are pretty nice, but nothing overly special. I didn't have any complaints and none of my group members had problems either. However, the best part of the hotel has to be the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Come and stay at The Melia....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you looking for something different from others Hotels stay in the downtonn of Ponce and enjoy the historic and beatyfull Melia in Ponce. If you looking for see all the atractions and museums at walking distance this is the place to stay..Have a lovely swiming pool and the best internet wireless free for the guest.Dont waste your time looking others Hotels in Ponce ,this is the right Place to go..

Reviews.Title: “Waiting for the renovation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In researching Ponce for upcoming art tours, I'd heard that the Melia Hotel was the only hotel to consider for our clientele. Given its central location, I decided to check it out. However, instead of the "historic and charming" hotel I had hoped to find, I was surprised to see such a tired and dated hotel. I was uncomfortable about the cleanliness of the rooms and the dated furnishings, and the stale odors and poor natural lighting in some rooms were definite liabilites. For those simply seeking a place to stay, but nothing more, this will certainly do. It is true that this hotel is preferred over others in Ponce (some which don't have windows in the guests rooms for example), however, I will have to wait for the renovation that will return the Melia to the glory it deserves.

Reviews.Title: “A Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller65
Reviews.Content: We went to Ponce at the last minute and had heard about Hotel Melia as a quaint, historical hotel. We are always looking for interesting places to stay, so we decided to give it a try. The location is convenient since it is located on the Central Square and the "ice cream" parlor is definitely a highlight. Twenty-four hour security parking is available, so be sure to ask at check in. The hotel was in fact old and certainly gave us a view of Ponce during its more glamourous years. However, the rooms were disappointing. The furniture is old, which isn't bad since it is an old hotel, but there are stains on the cushions. I asked for my room to be changed when the bathroom floor did not appear to have been clean, and numerous hairs were found on the bed. The room I was changed to was not much better, but since we were only staying one night, we decided to settle in. This is truly unfortunate because the hotel has much potential but seriously needs some TLC and better housekeeping. On a more positive note the continental breakfast was quite good consisting of fresh pastries, juice, and coffee. The staff was also very accommodating and assisted us with many inquiries about the area.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay but not to dine in”
Reviews.Author: humanone
Reviews.Content: The hotel Melia has rooms of many prices, but the best are the newer ones (of course the most expensive, but still reasonable) which have balconies facing the plaza with its Cathedral and fantastic old firehouse. The older balcony rooms are OK, but smaller. The least expensive rooms have windows at the 0utside corridor, so you only have a choice of privacy or daylight. Great location, friendy staff. But...the restaurant Marks at the Melia is way overrated and expensive; don't eat there. Best restaurant in town is the Rincon Argentino, about 3 blocks from the Plaza on Sol Street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were four adults moving through from San Juan (after a cruise) to Cabo Rojo. Wanted some local flavour so booked the Melia prior to our trip. Read the reviews first and booked a superior room in the new section $105.(We had a look at some of the rooms in the old section, and it seemed to me that the rooms facing the street were quite large while those across the hall were rather small.)Everything about the place was pleasantly surprising, but especially the location right on the town square. We shopped explored and took the free trolley ride around this very interesting and dynamic city. Lots of renovation going on. We walked along the streets at night, even the quiet ones, and found a restaurant, recommended by the front desk, with many local regulars in attendance. Although our stay was short, it was enjoyable, rounded out by breakfast on the canopied rooftop cafe. We made a final tour around the city before heading on to Cabo Rojo.

Reviews.Title: “"EXELLENT CHOICE"”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Perfect choice,you are in the downtown Ponce you can see all the attractions you can ride in a trolley the old firehouse(fAMOUS) is in front of the Hotel HAVE A LOVELY SWIMING POOL AND SMALL BUSINESS CENTER AND THE INTERNET ACCESS IS FREE FOR THE GUEST DONT LOSE YOUR TIME FINDING OTHER HOTELS FAR AWAY FROm THE downtown i have plans to return next year..

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: InMiami
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel Melia in Ponce in February, 06. The room had a king size bed and faced the inner â€œcourtyardâ€� and cost $109 (including tax) per night for two adults. The location of the Melia can not be beat. It is right off the main square of the historic district. The building looks very grand from the street and the entrance is regal. The reception area is of good size with high ceilings. The staff was friendly and professional, all spoke English. The room was moderate in size and had a good sized closet. The furnishings were simple but tasteful. The bathroom was clean and reasonably up-to-date; the tub was a bit short but quite deep. The cable TV had quite a few English channels. The room was quiet but there was a slight rattle from the air-conditioner when turned on high. The halls outside were protected by an overhang and you could look down into the semi enclosed sitting area. The parking is $3 per night and includes in/out privileges, a bargain! The simple complementary buffet breakfast included fresh pastries, cereal, toast, juices, and coffee with available heated milk. There were no eggs, meat, cheese or yogurt. There was an attractive enclosed roof deck area and open deck area to take your breakfast. The view was spectacular with the mountains in the distance. I have seen pictures of their pool but we were too busy touring Ponce to use it. The use of computers/internet is free though inside an office near the lobby. All and all we liked the Melia. It is not luxurious but certainly comfortable. There an old world ambience found throughout the hotel. The staff is welcoming and the location is perfect. We considered this hotel a good value and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget accommodations in downtown Ponce”
Reviews.Author: JessLM
Reviews.Content: Hotel Melia is a great value and is right in the middle of downtown Ponce. The hotel staff is very professional and friendly and helpful if you ask for suggestions/recommendations/directions. Like someone else said, the hotel looks like it was once very elegant and is now older and just holding up. It is not in bad shape but is just old. Overall I thought this place was decent. Included in the price of the room is a continental breakfast which is small, but I wouldn't expect much more for free. A couple cleanliness issues though: Two times, on different days, I found women's hairs in our bathroom towels, which is just gross. Also there was a small ant problem in the bathroom. Lastly, one night I was in the shower, and I saw something fall from the nozzle area, and I looked down to see an inch-long roach near my feet, trying desperately not to drown. Kinda gross. About the area: Ponce gets really dead at night. We had to really hunt to find good restaurants at night. We found an Argentinian restaurant not far from the hotel which was good. In downtown Ponce, the police are EVERYWHERE. It was crazy. Our Continental flight came in at 4:30am and we rented a car. A cop pulled us over as we drove through town, just to find out what we were doing on the streets. Well, we were looking for our hotel! He then told us to turn the car around and gave us an escort there, which was nice, but still, a bit daunting. Cool stuff to see in the area: Tibes archeological site, Camuy park, Arecibo radio telescope, caves near Arecibo, Cabo Rojo lighthouse (beautiful views, cliffs). To avoid, in my opinion: La Parguera bioluminescent bay- it's a scam! In the photos they make it look like it just glows and they take you on a boat ride and then 5-10 people (employees) jump off the boat and as they move their arms around in the water, you're supposed to ooh and ahh because the water is slightly blue. Ponce is a great place for all the rest though and I would definitely recommend it. People in the area are very friendly and welcoming. It is an affordable vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Yadi77
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I are originally from Ponce, but this was our first time staying here--we are getting married back home and needed to take care of some stuff, so it was business, not pleasure. Hotel staff was very polite and helpful, although I wouldn't say all out friendly. The room was bigger than I expected--although a bit dusty--and the bed was truly comfortable, sheets were clean. My one hotel pet peeve is bathrooms. I know it's an old building and big bathrooms are a hassle to clean. At a quick glance, our bathroom seemed clean, but once you took a closer look it was just poorly tended. During our 3 night stay, the tub had hair and soap/dirt film (we always showered standing on a hand towel), the sink had traces of the previous guest's toothpaste and toiletries looked re-packaged. We did get clean towels and we should have probably requested that the bathroom be cleaned, but we were on a tight schedule and didn't stop to think about this. If you suffer from dust allergies, try to avoid this hotel. In addition to being an old building, it is also located in the heart of a traffic congested area--which otherwise, also makes it a great location tourist-wise. The reception is beautiful and the complimentary breakfast (local pastries, cereal, juice and coffee) at the rooftoop, overlooking the city, is a real treat. Because we suffer from allergies, and bathroom cleanliness is a big issue for me, I would consider other options before the Melia. But for its value, it's certainly the best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: lunettes_noires
Reviews.Content: Right on the main square. Room was a bit cramped, which was not helped by the fact that the bathroom door swung into the bedroom towards the bed. Still, a decent value considering the location, charming old-world ambiance and free internet.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant melia hotel on the square”
Reviews.Author: artnuvo
Reviews.Content: ponce is an old town about 75 miles and a 90 minute drive from san juan, with several tolls. it has many art nouveau and art deco buildings and homes, some of which are in the process of being restored. there is a lovely art museum with a small but excellent european collection, including a pre-raphealite room, and currently an excellent frida kahlo exhibit that travelled from moma in nyc, an excellent history museum and adjacent music museum in art nouveau style,etc--take the guided english, free tours. we stayed for two nights at the melia hotel on and off the plaza-family owned for a century, with the "newer" pre-(1960's added rooms) in better shape than some of the the other rooms. the double bedded rooms in the newer section which face the inner courtyard are the equivalent of a 2 star hotel-clean, basic, air conditioned decent sleepable beds, and a small bathroom. the staff and the front desk are very pleasant, friendly, and helpful. marks at the melia is a well-known 4 star restaurant on the island. the melia has a small pool which makes you fell like you are continents aw ay and not in a charming city. if modern is your desire, 4-5 miles out of the city and a 15 minute drive to the city, are the hilton or holiday inn which could be in anywhere usa. good traditional criollo and other food is in easy walking distance on isabel street-including don juan lunch buffet for $5, acafe topmpy for inepensive criollo fare, portos, a nautical design interio with pasta, a grill, and excellent pizza with a semi-baked mozarrella topping and shrimp (very large and good for 2 at $15), vegetables, etc, el rincon for argnetine/steak and other food, very large portions at $18-23 entrees, and fusion which we did not eat at but is on the order of el rincon in price. the wonderful chef's creation is 2 blocks from the square with lunchtime 3-course meals at $6, including a soda. a 30-45 minute drive on route 52/118 and turning left at the 3rd traffic light on 118 in guanica brings you to cana grande public beach-$3 entrance fee-- which is a nice crescent shaped beach which the copamarina beach resort shares at one end. the public beach has a small snack bar at which food can be purchased and chairs can be rented. if you want to also hike, the nearby guanica state reserve,semi-tropical, like aruba, 2nd traffic light on 118, and a several mile uphill drive, has several trails from short to long and is known for its bird life-but hiking in 90 degree weather is not for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Melia Hotel (Dec 8 & 9, 2005) in Ponce, Puerto Rico. We had not made reservations since we were on a driving tour. We were interested in visiting the Frida Kahlo Exhibit at Ponce Museum of Art, so we decided to try and find a hotel that could accommodate us. I use a walker to get around and steps are almost impossible. When we arrived at the entrance, there were two very big steps and as soon as the staff saw me, they carried out this huge ramp. Too steep for me, I opted to accept the help of three employees and my better half, Kevin to get up the steps. Unfortunately, their handicapped accessible rooms were occupied and instead the manager â€œQuiqueâ€� escorted us to one of their inside terrace rooms. The inside terrrace was decorated with plants and poinsettias and at the far end was a great pool with a small waterfall. We went up two tiny steps, not too bad and through a beautiful set of wooden doors as we then entered a very spacious room with a king size bed. Since the shower was not accessible, we were offered a shower chair. Breakfast was included and we asked about their rooftop terrace. We were disappointed to find out that the elevator only went up to the third floor and that it was another flight up. No problem said Quique, weâ€™ll deliver breakfast to you every morning! I doubt the handicapped rooms they have could be in a better location than then room offered to us and despite some minor difficulties moving about (which is to be expected in such an old city) we both agreed to stay at the Melia. We have to say that everyone in Ponce was helpful, kind and very willing accommodate us. We even got our own personalized trolley ride, which everyone should do when they first arrive to familiarize themselves with the city! We felt very safe walking in and around the plaza, which had been restored into a beautiful gem and decorated for the Christmas season. The most gratifying part of our visit to Ponce was staying at the Melia, where all of the staff tried their very best to fulfill the needs of their clientele. Itâ€™s truly much more satisfying to stay at a smaller hotel than at a resort where you often are invisible. Thank you so much to Quique, his dad and all the staff that made our visit there just wonderful! We truly would have liked to have stayed longer, but know that when we return to Ponce, we will stay at Melia again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: big0wolf
Reviews.Content: Hotel Melia is perfect for a first time visitor to Ponce who wants to visit the museums and historic sites. We rode the trolley around when we first got there and got a feel for the city. Most within walking distance of this hotel. We arrived early and they allowed us to check in, AND they upgraded us to one of the balcony rooms overlooking Plaza de delicias. The view from the room was great, except at night, as the street noises are audible even with the AC on high. Try to get a room farther from the street. The pool was very nice. The setting for breakfast on the roof was beautiful, even if the food was basically cereal, cake and bread. There is a secure parking lot adjacent to the hotel where we parked for just $3/day. All in all a good experience and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Maj Oscar Palermo -- US Army”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I always stay at this hotel. I was borned in Ponce 40 years ago. The hotel management is great. This is the best hotel to stay since you can go out, buy your souveniers, then come back to your room without taking any transportation, secure your souveniers and go back to either visitng other places and/or continuing shopping. Everything is walking distance from this hotel, including Ponce best historic attractions. I recommend stay at the Melia. Price is fair.
